poem:
Title: "Beneath the Golden Tower's Shadow"

A sleight of hand, a sly man's smile,
Salvation sails through tainted miles.
Pulled from the brink, by the puppeteer's cord,
Danced upon the market and board.

Midst queries and qualms, he rises anew,
His empire valued at a staggering view.
Billions beckon behind walls of change,
But in shadows, the truth exchanges strange.
